title: Ancient Horrors
opening: With her bracelet recovered, Eirika sets out with renewed determination. Passing through the ancient forest Za’ha brings them close to Grado’s border. As they near the town of Serafew, Eirika’s fears are assuaged by the lack of troops. But never-before-seen terrors crawl in the shadows of the trees.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: We’re approaching Serafew, at the border of Renais and Grado. Once we cross, we’ll be in Grado... Renvall won’t be much farther.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: That is, assuming we can cross the border without mishap... Oh! Look! Over there!

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Those strange figures... What...What are they? Are they...human? I’ve never seen anything like it. What could they be?

intro.speaker: Artur
intro.line: What have we done to deserve the trials before us? What is happening to us? How could such abominations walk out lands while the Sacred Stones protect us?

intro.speaker: Artur
intro.line: Lute, please, it’s dangerous outside the walls. Stay here in the village.

intro.speaker: Lute
intro.line: Those are revenants, aren’t they? They were the vanguard of the Demon King in the days of darkness. The Tome of Nazania describes them in chapter 2, section 7, paragraph 8.

intro.speaker: Artur
intro.line: You know of them?

intro.speaker: Lute
intro.line: Duh! I’m a prodigy. I can recall almost everything I see or hear. According to the book, revenants attack using razor-sharp claws. Sounds painful, wouldn’t you say?

intro.speaker: Artur
intro.line: Yes, er, well... Be that as it may, I must go aid those travelers outside. You should stay here within the safety of the village.

intro.speaker: Lute
intro.line: Very well. I don’t mind staying here. In fact, it seems that smarter choice.

intro.speaker: Lute
intro.line: Magic is far more powerful than any monster’s claws. The thickest hide and the strongest armor are useless against magic’s power. Yes, I supposed I could have studied swords, but only magic is worthy of me. Even if this village were to be assaulted by monsters, I could defend it perfectly.

intro.speaker: Artur
intro.line: Travelers, you must listen to me! The ancient forest of Za’ha is dangerous. Head south and pass through this place before the fiends surround you!

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Who are you?

intro.speaker: Artur
intro.line: My name is Artur. The temple has assigned me the task of cleansing the forest of these...things. There are so many of the fiends, though. I wonder if I stand much chance alone. So if you would, please flee now while you have the chance.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Fiends? You’re not talking about the same fiends that served the ancient Demon King? That can’t be right... They’re nothing but legends and fairy tales...

intro.speaker: Artur
intro.line: Yes, I felt the same say when I heard. And yet here they are. This place is filled with them. I wonder how far they’re spread... Surely they’re not in Renais alone.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: But..why are they here? How?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Beware, Your Highness! Something approaches!

intro.speaker: Artur
intro.line: Please allow me to deal with this. Evil shade! May the blessed light drive you from this land!

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: We ought to help. He can’t fight them all alone. Do you have orders?

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: Oh, my! Those travelers are being besieged by the agents of evil!

battle.speaker: Dozla
battle.line: Ha ha ha! Right you are, Lady L’Arachel!

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: I cannot allow this to happen! Come! We must charge down these cliffs and rush to their aid!

battle.speaker: Rennac
battle.line: We charge down these cliffs, and the only thing we’ll be rushing to is death. How about we find us a nice, gentle path down, hm?

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: Ah...Yes, well...Let us hurry nonetheless. I simply cannot abide those wicked beasts running amok!

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Do you see that old snag to the south of here? Bet it would make a handy bridge if you could knock it over. Take a weapon to it and give it a few good whacks. That should do it. Here, take this and give it a try. It ought to do the trick.

recruit-visit.speaker: Lute
recruit-visit.line: Your flesh shows no sign of putrefaction. It seems you’re not a revenant.

recruit-visit.speaker: Artur
recruit-visit.line: Well, I should hope not! I wanted you to know help has arrived. Please be patient a bit longer...

recruit-visit.speaker: Lute
recruit-visit.line: No, no. I insist on joining you in combat. I’ve been reading up on these revenants. They are, quite simply, no match for me. I am superior after all.

recruit-visit.speaker: Lute
recruit-visit.line: Your flesh shows no sign of putrefaction. It seems you’re not a revenant. I’ve decided to join you in battle now. My name is Lute. I’m a mage of superior wisdom and rare ability. I’ve been reading up on these revenants. They are, quite simply, no match for me. I am superior after all.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: We’ve killed all the monsters. Still, we’d best burn the bones to ash to be sure they don’t return.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I still can’t believe what we’ve been fighting here... I’d thought those fiends nothing more than myth and legend.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Those revenants are said to be the least of the dark creatures. And yet, the weakest of them could outmatch any normal man. We cannot take this enemy lightly.

end.speaker: Lute
end.line: Oh, yes. There are much worse then those revenants and the entombed... Let’s see, there’s the bonewalkers, mauthe doogs, gargoyles, baels... Why, I’ll bet you just about any creature of lore could be walking again. Yes, we’re in for some trouble. Even my fabulous power may not be enough.

end.speaker: Artur
end.line: O divine light, show me... Is this a sign of dark days to come?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: By all that’s holy, what is happening?

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Princess Eirika, perhaps it would be wise to return to Frelia and regroup. Pressing forward seems foolish in light of recent events. We cannot face both Grado’s forces and more of those terrible things.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Seth, I follow your point, and nothing would please me more then running for safety. But what of my brother? He and his men are still trapped in the same situation we are. I know full well that I may be leading us into even greater danger, but... Please try to understand.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: I do, my princess, and I vow to see you through this safely.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Aha! Foul creatures, beware! I, L’Arachel, bestow upon you the honor at banishment at my blessed hands!

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Oh...Where are the monsters?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Well, we just finished...

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Ah, glad tidings indeed! The heavens must be rejoicing! I am.. a tad disappointed however. After all, I did rush all the way here to show you the splendor of my might.

end.speaker: Dozla
end.line: Gwah ha ha! It’s a real shame, innit, Lady L’Arachel?!

end.speaker: Rennac
end.line: What’s shameful is the way you drag us around the countryside.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Pardon me, but...who are you?

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Me? Since you ask, please allow me to introduce myself. It is I, the true light and glory of the sacred realm of Rausten...

end.speaker: Dozla
end.line: Stop! Lady L’Arachel, you mustn’t continue! You cannot reveal your true identity here!

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Oh, yes, you’re right. Oh, I get so careless sometimes! Now, I must ride off in anonymity. Oh, how beautifully romantic!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Uh... Right.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Fare thee well, strangers. Perhaps our paths will cross again. Come, Dozla! Rennac! We ride!

end.speaker: Dozla
end.line: Gwah ha ha! Let’s go, Rennac!

end.speaker: Rennac
end.line: All right, all right.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: ...What was that about?
